reviews.text: Stayed there on a short one night business trip. Nice rooms, clean and for London fairly big. Not really for tourists, as the main shoppig areas are some distance away. Tube station Gloucestes Street is just 2 minutes away though and that takes to the West End in 5 Minutes. Busy road outside but the hotel is quiet. Friendly staff. Can't say much more since I 'only' slept there and I didn't have time for breakfast...:-((
reviews.title: Nice Business Hotel

reviews.text: Highly recommended for business travellers!
reviews.title: Decent, but not a great hotel

reviews.text: The Marriott South Kensington is at the end of the main hotel track at South Kensington, and is a good 10-15 minute walk from the station (although you can catch a bus if you're on a day pass). It's right opposite a big Sainsbury's supermarket, so if you need any toiletries etc, you can swing by there for a quick stopover. There are also some restaurants in the area around the tube that open late, so if you're hungry, there's plenty of choice.
reviews.title: lovely place to stay

reviews.text: The exterior of the hotel is pretty modern, but the interior of the rooms looks like it hasn't been renovated in years. Things are a little old around the edges, and even the bedlinen design looked like it hadn't been changed in years. Still, the room was clean as was to be expected, and was of a decent size (a king sized bed with plenty of room to spare).
reviews.title: Brilliant!!!!

reviews.text: Staff were generally well trained, although they didn't go out of their way to make you feel at home. The staff were flexible enough to let us leave our bags with them before our stay, and we did not have any complaints as to the quality of the service.
reviews.title: Loving Kensington, England

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights and rate this hotel average due to the small rooms.
reviews.title: Small Rooms but great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. Just a 5 minute walk from the Gloucster subway station.
reviews.title: Above average in general...

reviews.text: If you are travelling to London for business or holiday and only expect to sleep in the room, then this hotel is perfect. If you are looking for larger, spacious rooms to relax in, you may want to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Business Like

reviews.text: Taxi from LHR to the hotel was 50 pounds.
reviews.title: A Marriot in a great location

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very convenient to the museums, Harrods and Hyde Park and 5 mins walk from the tube to take you in to the city centre. Service was OK but about a week before we they sent us an email asking our preferences eg non allergic bedding and whether we wanted a room on a higher floor. We emailed back saying we wanted the non allergic bedding as my wife is asthmatic and a room on a higher floor. When we arrived we were given what amounted to a basement room with very little natural light and feather bedding. I then had to wait a while for them to find my email and put it right which to their credit they did, they also left us a small body of wine as an apology.
reviews.title: Generally good, safe choice

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several time, mostly because it is convenient for my work and the only reasonable priced Marriott hotel this side of the city.
reviews.title: Horrible Service

reviews.text: The service at this hotel is horrible. The staff is rude, they never answer the phone (outside callers continually complain to me when they try to call my room and internal calls are never answered either).
reviews.title: Super Duper Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It does have decent tube connections and the Sainburys and Starbucks across the street.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Not sure how this hotel rates so high on trip advisor. It is a nice place, rooms are nice. But anyone who has any contact with staff has to be so completely offended by the rudeness.
reviews.title: great location, but...

reviews.text: Fantastic bunch of people at this hotel. Very warm & hospitable.
reviews.title: great place for an american family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service, the rooms, and the cleanliness of the hotel is typical of all Marriotts. Also typical however is the overprices wifi.. 15 pounds a day! OUCH! I only give it a 4 star because of the location. It is a walk to the nearest tube line, and on a busy road. Not many coffee shops nearby. Unfortunately we were unable to use the pool because the hotel must rent it out to the public because there was swimming lessons for kids taking over the pool while we were there. The concierge was helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, for a rainy day

reviews.text: Good hotel and would stay again.
reviews.title: Not central but a nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - small but spotless, comfortable bed and nice amenities let down by thin walls so noisy neighbours would be an issue. Rooms on first floor accessed via narrow staircase - must be where corporate rate stays go, didn't buy the line 'no other rooms available'.
reviews.title: Very nice business hotel

reviews.text: Restaurant - nice restaurant, food fine and service what you would expect but £18 for uninspired continental, come on!! Sainsburys supermarket across the road a much better option and recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: Cabs - not great for picking up a cab in the morning despite efforts of front desk. Be wary of asking for a cab to the airport - always seemed to be private cars with drivers sitting outside. Got the impression you get 'encouraged' to use one of these if you ask for the airport instead of a black cab. Are they licensed and insured??
reviews.title: Smart Marriott Hotel with usual Marriott comforts.
